stories.title: Initialize Ledger project with Next.js 16 and SQLite
stories.description: Bootstrap the expense tracking app with all foundational dependencies and database schema
acceptance: Next.js 16 app created using `bunx create-next-app@latest app --ts --tailwind --eslint --app --src-dir --use-bun --yes`
Biome configured for linting and formatting using `cd app && bun add -d @biomejs/biome && bunx @biomejs/biome init`
SQLite database configured with better-sqlite3
Database schema includes expenses table (id, amount, description, category_id, created_at) and categories table (id, name, color, icon)
shadcn/ui initialized with base components using `bunx shadcn@latest add button card input`
Global styles set up with prefers-color-scheme for automatic light/dark mode
Whimsical font scale hierarchy using clamp() for responsive typography
Mobile-first viewport meta configured
Bun as package manager with lockfile committed

stories.title: Quick expense entry with amount and optional description
stories.description: Enable rapid expense logging with minimal friction - amount first, details optional
acceptance: Large numeric keypad optimized for thumb reach on mobile
Amount input uses dynamic viewport sizing (min 10vh height)
Currency formatting applied as user types
Optional description field appears after amount confirmed
Single tap to save expense with default 'Uncategorized' category
Haptic feedback on save (where supported)
Expense saved to SQLite immediately
Borderless, Apple-like minimal input UI with no visible borders or boxes
No onboarding or splash screen - straight to entry

stories.title: Create and manage expense categories
stories.description: Allow users to define custom categories with colors and icons for organizing expenses
acceptance: Default categories seeded: Food, Transport, Entertainment, Bills, Shopping, Health
Each category has name, color (hex), and emoji icon
Add new category with color picker and emoji selector
Edit existing category name, color, and icon
Delete category with confirmation (expenses reassigned to Uncategorized)
Categories displayed as color-coded pills with emoji
Category list uses typographic hierarchy - large names, subtle metadata
Swipe-to-delete gesture on category items
Changes persisted to SQLite categories table

stories.title: Swipe gestures to categorize uncategorized expenses
stories.description: Enable quick categorization of expenses through intuitive swipe interactions
acceptance: Uncategorized expenses shown in a swipeable card stack
Swipe left/right reveals category options
Quick swipe assigns most-used category automatically
Long swipe opens full category picker
Visual feedback shows category color on swipe direction
Card animates out on successful categorization
Undo toast appears for 3 seconds after categorization
Empty state when no uncategorized expenses remain
Touch-friendly hit targets (min 44px)
Smooth 60fps animations using CSS transforms

stories.title: View, edit, and delete expenses
stories.description: Full expense management with list view and individual expense editing
acceptance: Chronological expense list grouped by day
Each expense shows amount (large), category pill, description, time
Tap expense to edit amount, description, or category
Swipe left to reveal delete action
Delete requires confirmation tap (no modal)
Pull-to-refresh updates list from database
Infinite scroll for historical expenses
Search/filter by category or description
Empty state with friendly illustration when no expenses
Dynamic typography scales with viewport width

stories.title: Monthly spending summary with category breakdown
stories.description: Provide clear monthly overview of spending habits and category distribution
acceptance: Current month summary shown by default
Total spent displayed prominently using large viewport-relative type (8vh)
Category breakdown as horizontal stacked bar
Each category shows amount and percentage of total
Tap category to see expenses in that category for the month
Swipe horizontally to navigate between months
Comparison to previous month (up/down indicator with percentage)
Daily average calculated and displayed
Summary persists correctly across app restarts

stories.title: Visual spending trends and analytics
stories.description: Display spending patterns over time with interactive charts
acceptance: Line chart showing daily spending for current month
Area chart showing cumulative spending through the month
Donut chart for category distribution
Charts support light/dark mode with appropriate colors
Touch to see exact values on data points
Smooth animations on chart load and data changes
6-month trend view available via tab
Charts use minimal, borderless aesthetic matching app style
Responsive sizing using vw/vh units
Loading skeleton while charts render

stories.title: Reliable data persistence and sync
stories.description: Ensure all expense data is reliably stored and survives app restarts
acceptance: All expenses persisted to SQLite via better-sqlite3
Database file stored in app data directory
Transactions used for multi-step operations
Optimistic UI updates with rollback on failure
Error toast displayed if save fails
Database migrations versioned and automated
Export data as JSON functionality
Import data from JSON backup
Data integrity validated on app start
